recipes.title: Chunky Chippers
instructions: Cream-together the butter, peanut butter, eggs, sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, and water.
Stir-in the flour, baking soda, and salt.
summary: Drop dough by large teaspoons onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 to 14 minutes (cookies should be light brown and slightly underdone). Remove from sheet to cool.

recipes.title: Gorgonzola Popovers
instructions: Whisk together eggs, milk, melted butter, flour, salt, pepper, and thyme and refrigerate for 2 hours.
Butter 2 mini muffin pans. Fill each cup to the top with batter.
summary: Adjust the oven rack to the highest position in oven and bake at 425 degrees for 18 to 20 minutes until puffed and golden.
Great served as an appetizer with red wine.

recipes.title: Big Sandwich
description: The big sandwich is a family favorite for casual dinners. The kids often requested it when we were going out for the evening.

ingredients.name: thinly sliced Swiss or Havarti cheese

instructions: Slice the French loaf in half lengthwise, if the loaf is really thick, scoop out some of the bread middle.
Spread both sides liberally with mayo and as much mustard as you like.
Layer the ham, turkey, and cheese on the bottom half of the loaf.
Top with the tomatoes, salt and pepper to taste, onions and shredded lettuce.
Place the top of the loaf on and wrap the whole sandwich tightly in saran wrap. Refrigerate until ready to slice.
